intro: Phlegmariurus catacachiensis, commonly known as the Catacachiens rockmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, flattened, and often crust-like growth form. This plant thrives in rocky and arid environments, typically found in high-altitude regions of South America. Its structure consists of a thallus with distinct lobes and a system of rhizoids for anchoring and nutrient absorption. Phlegmariurus catacachiensis is adapted to withstand extreme environmental conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
